answerText: Anne Frank[10] This Romanian-born American Jew wrote about his time in Auschwitz and Buchenwald in his Night. He also wrote a work in which a group of Holocaust survivors put God on trial.
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 11 | 15 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: Answer some questions about autobiographical accounts of the Holocaust, for 10 points each: [10] Undoubtedly the most famous account of living through the Holocaust of the diary of this girl, who lived in an attic with her father Otto, sister Margot, and several others.
